metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8927 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow exists in the Brotli library versions prior to 1.0.8 where an attacker controlling the input length of a "one-shot" decompression request to a script can trigger a crash, which happens when copying over chunks of data larger than 2 GiB. It is recommended to update your Brotli library to 1.0.8 or later. If one cannot update, we recommend to use the "streaming" API as opposed to the "one-shot" API, and impose chunk size limits.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8927` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

brotli - 1.0.7-6ubuntu0.1
libbrotli1 - 1.0.7-6ubuntu0.1
python3-brotli - 1.0.7-6ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: brotli package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.7-6ubuntu0.1').
